Posts.Content: Fantastic news! So pleased for you. I've finished my chemo 3 weeks ago,  had picc line out last Friday cos I've been told I can have future herceptin by injection. Having the line out felt like a small step on the road back to normality, so I can just imagine how great you must be feeling. My next step is op (therapeutic mammoplasty ) on 10th April then 20 rads  ... counting down the days to getting these milestones ticked off. Much love to everyone, whatever stage you're at xx
Posts.Title: Last radiotherapy session done and ticked off - yay!

Posts.Content: Thanks everyone for your good wishes  ... you are all amazing and so kind xxx
Posts.Title: good evening

Posts.Content: Hi All, I suffered with breathing problems during Chemotherapy at the beginning of this year, and was given steroids which helped a lot. I then had my op followed by radiotherapy, which finished in August. Since then I have had a couple of colds, and they always go straight to my chest. About three weeks ago I went to my GP with a persistent cold and cough, and he diagnosed bronchitis, gave me antibiotics, steroids and a ventolin inhaler - within three days I was so much better! When I went back 10 days later for a follow-up, he said he thought I had adult onset asthma, quite possibly brought on by radiotherapy, and told me to hold on to the inhaler. I've been coughing for three days now, but the inhaler is definitely helping! He did say he thinks it will eventually resolve itself too. xx
Posts.Title: wheezing and inhalers

Posts.Content: Thanks fellow Ali. To be honest I just want it over and done with now. I've been walking round the house today singing "bye bye boobie, boobie bye byeeee!" a la Bay City Rollers! Now that shows my age eh?! I know my surgery is afternoon so will update once I'm feeling human again! Xxx
Posts.Title: good evening

Posts.Content: I had thrush nearly all the way thru chemo but luckily it seems to have stopped with the chemo. It's bloody miserable tho eh? Hope it clears up soon xx
Posts.Title: good evening

Posts.Content: Couldn't agree more ... people keep telling me how well I look and how I'm over the worst just cos I've finished chemo! If only it were that simple eh? Xx
Posts.Title: good evening

Posts.Content: Surgeon just been round and drawn all over me and should be going to theatre between 3 and 4pm. Torture time now ... They are just serving lunch to the rest of the ward ... can you all hear my tummy rumbling?! Lol xxx
Posts.Title: good evening

Posts.Content: How's your legs after your herceptin Ali? Mine not too bad tho I did have pretty bad cankles over the weekend.  Did you get the foot spa out? I didn't bother cos it's in one of those Narnia type cupboards  ... if I go in for it I may never be seen again! Xx
Posts.Title: good evening

Posts.Content: Fantastic fellow Ali! I'm ahead of you treatment - wise but definitely behind you in getting back into my stride!  You put me to shame ... All I've managed today has been the breast care exercises! Tut tut eh?! Xxx
Posts.Title: A big step today

Posts.Content: I was told not to do the exercises for 2 weeks because of the type of op I had ... still gonna do them now even tho it's all coming off in 5 weeks! May go to the gym for some gentle uphill walks on the treadmill this week  ... I miss the gym and my bike xx
Posts.Title: A big step today

Posts.Content: HAPPY BIRTHDAY fellow Ali. Have a wonderful day. Big hugs xxxx
Posts.Title: HAPPY BIRTHDAY

Posts.Content: Fan - bloody - tastic!! So pleased for you,  it's such a great feeling eh? I remember the chemo nurse drawing a smiley face and writing a huge well done in my chemo book at my last one ... I burst into tears on the spot! Celebrate and enjoy! Xxx
Posts.Title: DONE IT !!!

Posts.Content: Hi Pat, I'm feeling really good thanks. Had dressings off on Tuesday and all healing very well but no results back yet because of the bank holiday. Had seroma drained by BCN but it already looks like I'm growing a new boob under my arm again!  Lol. Back to clinic next Tuesday for results. Getting bit bored now with not being able to do anything when I feel so well ... so I've joined the ladies on the Knitted Knockers site and am gonna start knitting for them! Will be starting off with one for myself in case it goes wrong!! Xxx
Posts.Title: DONE IT !!!

Posts.Content: Hi Ali, I expect it's like mine ... what you already have in is a clip marker. And tomorrow morning they will put in a wire to guide the surgeon. Good luck with everything, big virtual hugs xxx
Posts.Title: mammogram before op

Posts.Content: Ooh delicious  ... set me up for a good weekend  ... hubby working nights so he won't be giving me sideways looks if I'm staring at these JD pics all evening :-)  xx
Posts.Title: antidepressants

Posts.Content: Ooh you have just made my day, week, month with those pics  :-).  I have a great one of me and him taken in New York a few years ago .... ok, so maybe it was his waxwork but who cares, it looks quite convincing lol. Gonna have some sweet dreams tonight xxx
Posts.Title: antidepressants

Posts.Content: Not a cat lover usually  ... but have to admit that is cute xx
Posts.Title: antidepressants

Posts.Content: Johnny Depp every time for me ... especially in his Boho phase mmmm xx
Posts.Title: antidepressants

Posts.Content: Hi fellow Ali, like everyone says rads are given to "mop up" any stray cancer cells. Did your surgeon not explain it to you when he discussed your op? I know mine did, cos up til that stage I wasn't 100% sure I would be having rads. He explained that they always give rads with lumpectomy or TM (the op I had). Wishing you good luck, love and hugs for your op ... getting my dressings off and pathology report on Tuesday  ... can't wait! Xxx
Posts.Title: silly question time !!!

Posts.Content: Hi Denise, I'm sitting in bed writing this because I had one of those days yesterday and I feel today is gonna be much the same. I finished chemo in February and had my op 3 weeks ago. That's all healing really well but unfortunately it wasn't the great success we all hoped it would be and now have to have mastectomy on 29th May. I've been suffering terrible joint pains from herceptin and still have really bad peripheral neuropathy too. Hubby went back to work yesterday and daughter away for weekend ... thought I was gonna feel so good home alone doing what I wanted but no ... I just felt abandoned and sorry for myself. So I know just how you're feeling. I think my sister is coming over tomorrow so hopefully that will help, as we'll probably go out for a pub lunch! Have a good time with your family today ... oh and sorry for hijacking your thread with my own moans and groans xxx
Posts.Title: Feeling down today ....

Posts.Content: Mmmm lovely, I love rhubarb crumble, and feel very jealous of you now. I'm sure you feel much better after your tears too. My sis is definitely coming tomorrow and we're planning some retail therapy! Settling down with a glass of wine and antiques roadshow now - life in the fast lane eh?! Hope you get the answers you need on Tuesday xxx
Posts.Title: Feeling down today ....

Posts.Content: Hi all, I'm hoping that some of you lovely ladies can help me. I'm due to have my op on 10th April and have opted for a Therapeutic Mammoplasty as my boobs are large and my surgeon says there is "plenty of volume" for him to achieve a good result. He was brilliant in explaining the operation to me but fell a bit short on the after care. I have an appointment with my bcn at clinic on Thursday to discuss in more detail but I know that I will get better info and advice from this forum. I just wondered if any of you have had this op as I don't recall seeing any posts where it is mentioned. Would love to hear from anyone with their experiences. Thank you xx
Posts.Title: TM

Posts.Content: Ooh thank you ... I'm seeing oncologist and BCN tomorrow so I'm sure I will have lots of questions after. They are both great but I still think you get best info from someone who has been through it. Will be in touch tomorrow evening I'm sure xx
Posts.Title: TM

Posts.Content: One question I have still ... what make of bra did you wear after your surgery? My bcn told me about a couple of brands but I have just been looking online and cannot find any at all in my size ... she said to buy the same size I usually wear but none of the ones I have found come in a big enough cup size. I wear a 34GG and the largest I have found is an F cup ... guess I'm gonna have to take myself into the big stores and just try some on xx
Posts.Title: TM

Posts.Content: I'm having a TM (pretty obvious really I guess from the discussion title!) on the left side. Saw my bcn yesterday and she showed me pics which I think have finally brought home to me just what is happening! Have actually been feeling quite low and emotional today, not like me at all, but I guess there's nothing normal about this cancer thing eh? Xx
Posts.Title: TM

Posts.Content: I'm not at all worried about the op as in the past 10 years I've had a hysterectomy for very large fibroids,  a very large ovarian cyst and one ovary removed and my big toe joint replaced  ... All on the left side!! What I think I'm struggling with is how different my breast may look after. I know it's silly and this has to be done as after all that little nasty that's still in there (albeit a bit smaller  ... Thank you chemo) was trying to kill me! And I have been offered "symmetry surgery" further down the line. I've been told by the bcn that my surgeon's skills with a needle and with this op are legendary  ... so eventually I know I will be the proud owner of a lovely new pair ... and will hopefully be able to buy dresses that fit properly, rather than having to stick to skirts or trousers and tops in completely different sizes!! That's my positive thought for today :-)  xx
Posts.Title: TM

Posts.Content: Thanks so much ... This is by far the best info I have found so far. I'm very careful about where I look for information and don't Google too much because there is so much bad info out there. It was more knowing what to wear after, how long dressings would be on, that type of thing I was looking for. I'm sure my bcn will cover it on Thursday but just thought I would do a little more research first xx
Posts.Title: TM

Posts.Content: Hi Amylou, can I ask what op you had? Xx
Posts.Title: TM

Posts.Content: I've now discovered that M&S do a post op one in a G cup so will have a trip into town early part of next week and see if they will fit ... will probably get away with it if it's soft. I usually end up at bravissimo or Debenhams  ... Their gorgeous range is very good. I like the fact that if you buy a specific post-op bra then you don't pay vat on it. Thanks for your help xx
Posts.Title: TM

Posts.Content: Unfortunately there doesn't seem to be anything that can be done for it, other than hope it eventually goes! Apparently if it starts during chemo they reduce the dosage but a bit late for those of us when it starts after eh? Xx
Posts.Title: Neuropathy

Posts.Content: Hi Amanda, I finished chemo almost 7 weeks ago now and started suffering from neuropathy a week or so after the last one. My fingers feel numb almost all of the time. My oncologist said that it may improve over the next few months but unfortunately sometimes it can be permanent. It's really getting me down at the moment because I do a lot of cross stitching but am struggling to even feel the needle ... I have been knitting instead but even that feels strange. I hope yours clears up soon xx
Posts.Title: Neuropathy

Posts.Content: Hi Genny, glad to hear you're feeling a bit better today. I know how miserable this can be, having had months of it a few years ago when I was on codeine waiting for a foot operation.  I was lucky with my fec chemo but the tax floored me completely and I seemed to get every side effect going ... except I had diarrhoea rather than constipation! I felt like giving up after my first cycle of tax but suddenly turned a corner when I was laid in bed watching dvds. I was watching Burlesque and near the end Cher sings a song called You haven't seen the last of me. Completely different scenario but totally summed up how I felt at the time. When I looked for it on you tube it was posted with a caption at the end ... "sometimes a setback is a setup for a comeback". That's now on the lock screen on my phone! We can all do this and all come back so much stronger! Much love to you xxx
Posts.Title: Endgame!!

Posts.Content: Oh I meant to say too that my onco gave me fybrogel on prescription with  my first fec because she expected me to need it but I never did! So speak to your onco or gp and get it on prescription. Xx
Posts.Title: Endgame!!

Posts.Content: Oh I meant to say too that my onco gave me fybrogel on prescription with  my first fec because she expected me to need it but I never did! So speak to your onco or gp and get it on prescription. Xx
Posts.Title: Endgame!!

Posts.Content: I was thinking exactly the same this morning. I'm now day 19 post final chemo and finally felt up to doing a bit of housework. Hoovered the lounge and my head was dripping!! When I was in the couple of weeks following chemo I would wake up at night with a wet pillow ... so that's obviously where it's all going! Xx
Posts.Title: hot flush or just because I am bald

Posts.Content: Hi Genny, glad to hear you're feeling a bit better today. I know how miserable this can be, having had months of it a few years ago when I was on codeine waiting for a foot operation.  I was lucky with my fec chemo but the tax floored me completely and I seemed to get every side effect going ... except I had diarrhoea rather than constipation! I felt like giving up after my first cycle of tax but suddenly turned a corner when I was laid in bed watching dvds. I was watching Burlesque and near the end Cher sings a song called You haven't seen the last of me. Completely different scenario but totally summed up how I felt at the time. When I looked for it on you tube it was posted with a caption at the end ... "sometimes a setback is a setup for a comeback". That's now on the lock screen on my phone! We can all do this and all come back so much stronger! Much love to you xxx
Posts.Title: Endgame!!

Posts.Content: It's not too bad here in Reading today and yesterday was lovely. Both my girls were here and did a lovely bbq with a drop or three of vino too ;-) . Got my op follow up Tuesday and surgeon said they will drain my seroma  ... if the weekend continues as it started I'm just a little concerned that they will be draining pure alcohol lol. Have a great weekend everyone xxx
Posts.Title: enjoy bank holiday ♡♡·

Posts.Content: Woohoo! Just had my 5th dose of herceptin,  and the first by injection.  How easy was that??!! So much better,  I was in and out in less than half an hour and that included extra "resting" time as my whole leg started to tingle and the nurse wanted to wait for it to stop before letting me go. I'm suffering from peripheral neuropathy anyway so one cup of coffee later I reassured her my feet were already  tingling  before I got there and my leg was now fine, and I was on my way! No more sub-cut envy by me now!! Xx
Posts.Title: Sub-cut herceptin

Posts.Content: Haha George,  at my age a quickie is always good, or I'm in danger of falling asleep halfway through! Lol xx
Posts.Title: Sub-cut herceptin

Posts.Content: They only started doing sub-cut at our hospital (Royal Berks, Reading) last month  ... perfect timing for me as I had just finished chemo and only had to have one through picc line which was then taken straight out giving me freedom and proper showers!! Have a good easter everyone ... I'm now at my sister's in Derby for the weekend, being spoilt and not having to do anything ... perfect! Xx
Posts.Title: Sub-cut herceptin

Posts.Content: Poor you ... I know you had loads of trouble with your picc line  ... I felt quite guilty cos mine was brilliant all the way through. I wish I could have kept it ... have always had bad veins but chemo has destroyed them completely it seems. Took 15 minutes to get a blood test out of me at my pre-op then nearly 20mins and 4 attempts to get somewhere to get the anaesthetic cannula in! My legs were bad 24/7 for about 5 days and I'm still having the odd bad night with them, but hopefully like some have said it gets better after the first few. Good luck tomorrow xx
Posts.Title: hiiiiiiiiiiii

Posts.Content: Hi Ali, hope appointment all good today. Hubby took me out for a pub lunch and I could actually TASTE the wine and enjoy it properly at last  ... only taken 8 weeks to get back to this stage lol. Have a great weekend xxx
Posts.Title: hiiiiiiiiiiii

Posts.Content: Just back from clinic ... Was told that rads will start 4 to 6 weeks after surgery dependant on healing. Was given a surgery follow up date of 21st April and will be given rads planning appointment after that. Xx
Posts.Title: surgery date

Posts.Content: You're welcome.  How you doing now after your final tax? Mine was a real bi*** for a good 2 and a half weeks, and has left me with peripheral neuropathy in my fingers and fluid retention in my legs and feet ... hey ho, at least I know it's also shrunk my little invader too so I'm so glad I stuck with it ... and tho on the worst days I really felt like I didn't want to go on, I'm feeling so good at the mo that it seems like a distant memory already. Xx
Posts.Title: surgery date

Posts.Content: Hi Ali, I had my final chemo on 20th Feb and my surgery date has been set for 10th April. They said it was supposed to be about 5 weeks after chemo but because I'm having TM I have to wait as not all surgeons do that op and my surgeon on hols til that week. Sitting in clinic now waiting for onc ... Gonna ask her the same question about rads but my boss told me last week he doesn't expect to see me back before mid June xx
Posts.Title: surgery date

Posts.Content: Hi there, I'm really good thanks. Surgeon has done a great job ... can't believe it will be a week ago tomorrow! Apparently there was a problem with intubation which also happened when I had an op 7 years ago. I should be getting a letter to carry all the time, but as I've not seen it yet, I'm beginning to think I dreamed it in my post anaesthesia state! Who knows eh? Will ask surgeon when I go for my follow up next Tuesday  ... After all he should know, he was in the room lol xxx how's you now? What about your legs after your injection? Xx
Posts.Title: hiiiiiiiiiiii

Posts.Content: Just skipped out of the hospital ... last rads today! Can't believe I've done it ... been a long 11 months since diagnosis but I made it!! I'm not counting the herceptin injections  ... tho the last one of those should be on New Year's Eve so that's gonna be one hell of a celebration!! Xxx
Posts.Title: Another Neddy passes the finish post!

Posts.Content: I recently had a huge rant on the M&S Facebook page about their post op bras. I agree they do have some very pretty ones ... if you are DD cup or smaller! I am a GG and they don't offer any post op bras above s G, and the ONE style for between DD and G looks like something that not even my granny would have worn! I saw my mastectomy in a very positive light because to me it was the start of my new, cancer free life, but the choice of underwear for us larger chested ladies put a bit of a downer on subsequent shopping trips. I ended up buying their one style of pretty full cup and sewing my own pocket in (our hospital does it but it takes 3 weeks and I wasn't very organised!!) Xx
Posts.Title: Pretty post mastectomy bras????

Posts.Content: Yes, I saw them on the news too, and had been discussing them a couple of days before when my BCN fitted me with my softie after my mastectomy. I've now joined them and am about to start my first sample knocker! Gonna do the first one my size in case it goes wrong, but hopefully I can soon get two approved and will become an official knockerette!!
Posts.Title: Knitted Knockers

Posts.Content: I had my 4th chemo last Friday and after having virtually sailed through the 3 FEC  I was so not expecting this! The Tax really has hit me like a brick wall and from working full time, walking and even managing a session at the gym I have gone to being bed - ridden since Wednesday, getting up only to go visit the throne room far too many times! Whether it's because I also had my first herceptin on Monday I'm not sure, as I've been told that should be a walk in the park compared to chemo. I know it has to be done ... and I can do it with the help and support of my family and all the wonderful ladies on this forum. Have a good weekend everyone xx
Posts.Title: Struggling after forth chemo

Posts.Content: Good morning fellow Ali, been a little while! I'm lucky with my hair, it's growing really well and everyone just assumes I've had it cut like this. But my nails are something else altogether! I always had beautiful nails, people thought they were fake, but now they're totally cr**! If they grow even a millimetre above the end of my finger they split and flake! I've tried so many supposed strengthening products but nothing works  ... mightily peed off with them now ... even buttons are a problem! Xxx
Posts.Title: neddys/moaning cows club !!!!

Posts.Content: And I thought it was me! Tried changing settings and all sorts of things, but was still getting nothing so I had no idea what all you lovely ladies (and gents) were up to! Love and hugs to all from this ex blue tit who is now morphing into a red breast!  Xx
Posts.Title: Not receiving emails from Macmillan/ who's a pretty. boy!!

Posts.Content: It's very sad, he was still a very good looking, very sexy man. I saw them probably over 35 years ago then saw him by himself in Reading a few years ago. We had seats just up behind the stage and spent a lot of time watching his wiggle! Then he turned round and held our hands for a while ... We definitely melted!  I already have my ticket for the Rewind Festival in August  ... Hot Chocolate are playing the Saturday and I hope they still play, though not sure it will be the same without him. Xx
Posts.Title: Hot chocolate

Posts.Content: I was feeling soooo good up until last night ... breakfast was a large intake of ibuprofen lol. Managed a pub lunch where I could actually taste the wine yesterday!! One of my sisters is coming over today so may just have to have another lol xxx have a good weekend xxx
Posts.Title: Are any of you having Herceptin injections?

Posts.Content: Hi Lorraine, I've only had one by injection after the first four IV. I had really bad problems with my legs for the first week. I had my surgery a week ago and have been taking ibuprofen so this must have been helping with my legs because I thought they were ok. But yesterday my boob felt fine so I didn't take any and have just had a really rough night with leg - and especially hip - pain keeping me awake for hours! There is another thread about this from a couple of weeks ago with a really good link to info from George. The thread is just called Herceptin. Hope it helps. I'm due my next by injection on Friday and not looking forward to it. Xxx
Posts.Title: Are any of you having Herceptin injections?

Posts.Content: No I don't subscribe to the menopause theory either  ... I had a hysterectomy at 46 ... They left my ovaries and 2 years later I had to have an ovarian cyst and one ovary removed. Went through menopause then, 7 and a half years ago. So I'm sure it's the Herceptin xxx and no, sorry I don't live near Exeter  ... I'm in Reading. Xxx
Posts.Title: Are any of you having Herceptin injections?

Posts.Content: Hi everyone, I haven't posted for a while, been busy back at work and in my spare time making KNITTED KNOCKERS!  Have any of you lovely ladies tried them? I am an official "knockerette" and have been making cotton prostheses since last June. They are so comfortable and lightweight. We also make Aquas, specially designed for wear in water (tho I also use mine in the gym). They are filled with shower scrunchies and made from 100% acrylic yarn, so they don't hold the water. We make 15 sizes as standard but can make any size to suit. I'm a 34GG  and mine fits perfectly and looks great! The best part about it is they are supplied completely free! Take a look at the website .... www.knittedknockersuk.com.  xx
Posts.Title: Swimming after Mastectomy

Posts.Content: Oops, my phone playing up again and only showing me half the thread! It's great to see knitted knockers being used by some ... I don't seem to have problems with the weight, but if you do, a fellow knockerette suggested popping a couple of marbles into the bottom ... worth a try? Xx
Posts.Title: Swimming after Mastectomy

Posts.Content: Brilliant ladies, so pleased for you both. Seems like the weekend is gonna be perfect for celebrations all round xxx
Posts.Title: I've only gone and done it !!

Posts.Content: Hi all, I haven't posted much lately but I've been following this thread with interest because I've just had my appointment to see my oncoplastic surgeon in February to discuss reconstruction. I have more than enough belly fat and just assumed that would be the way forward but was interested to read George's comment that they don't usually like to reconstruct over a C cup. I'm a GG so does this mean a big reduction on that side? Got my first year mammogram next Tuesday and I'm bricking it for some reason so maybe best see how that goes first? Xx
Posts.Title: Reconstruction advice and info please.....

Posts.Content: Had mine at beginning of October  ... its faded but still definitely blue! My daughter calls me mumma smurf! Xx
Posts.Title: blue boobs

Posts.Content: Which part of London are you in Wendy? I'm in Reading, not that far away, and my eldest daughter lives in New Cross xx thanks for your kind wishes too xx
Posts.Title: Good morning.

Posts.Content: And it's p***ing down in the South too ... and I've got soooo much washing to do too before surgery tomorrow ... oh well, hubby will have to sort it :-) xx
Posts.Title: Good morning.

Posts.Content: Thanks MrsD, now I've got my head around the fact it has to happen, I just want it over and done with! Gonna have a TV day too I think xx
Posts.Title: Good morning.

Posts.Content: Yes, big day number 2! But this is the one which will see the back of the little bugger once and for all! Thanks for your kind wishes xxx
Posts.Title: Good morning.

Posts.Content: Hi all, my hair coming along quite nicely now ... in fact hubby called me a show-off today cos I was combing it! It's not really long enough but I just thought I would tidy it up around the ears lol. Eyelashes still a bit short and stubby but I make sure the mascara goes on every day and I point out to everyone that I've got some!! I think since I stopped covering my hair with scarves or wigs it has grown a lot faster xx
Posts.Title: Hair coming back

Posts.Content: Hi everyone, just had to share my good news ... I went to see my oncologist this afternoon. Last week I had bronchitis and had to have a chest x-ray and ECG, and on Monday this week I had my heart echo for my herceptin review. She was very happy with all the results, but more importantly my first year mammogram, which was done a couple of weeks ago, was ALL CLEAR! I can't stop grinning now xx
Posts.Title: 1st year mammogram

Posts.Content: Oh I feel for you both ... you really have had a rough time of it lately I know. I don't post much but I follow loads of threads! I'm now day 13 post FINAL TAX!! and it has been tough these past two weeks. Fec was so easy in comparison and I carried on working. Tax has been a real bi*** tho and there have been many days when I just wanted to stop the world! Yesterday was my first full day out of bed in 10 days ... and I'm paying for it today with aching joints again! People have been so quick to remind me that it's my last one like that makes it so much easier  ... In theory yes, but when you're struggling even to lift your head off the pillow but the diarrhoea has hit and you gotta run ...... well they really don't have a clue eh?! Like you, I  know it's making me better, one scan showed that it had shrunk by 1 cm. .. which does at least mean I can have the op that I want! Well, let's be honest, I don't want an op any more than I wanted any of this, but I guess it's a bit late now!!! Good luck to everyone, whatever stage of treatment you're at xxx
Posts.Title: Horrible Taste in Mouth

Posts.Content: Happy birthday  ... have a great day! How is everyone? I've not been on here for so long! Xxx
Posts.Title: HAPPY BIRTHDAY !!!!!

Posts.Content: Happy birthday  ... have a great day! How is everyone? I've not been on here for so long! Xxx
Posts.Title: HAPPY BIRTHDAY !!!!!

Posts.Content: Congratulations to you! Some fantastic tips here for the newbies like me ... first FEC booked for next Friday and have been told today that I will also need Herceptin so my journey time has been extended! but I can already tell that this site is gonna get me through ... some amazing people on here!
Posts.Title: Last chemo done, 3 x FEC and 3 x Taxatere. Done! finito!!

Posts.Content: There is a great Macmillan cookbook which my girls downloaded  ... It has great recipes in for people affected by various side effects ie sore mouth etc.  Hopefully she won't suffer too many side effects ... but the recipes are all good anyway and well worth a look xx
Posts.Title: Marker clip and chemo?

Posts.Content: Oh and sorry I can't really answer your question about food on chemo day. All of mine were early morning so I just used to have toast before I went. At our chemo unit in Reading they bring round salads and sandwiches if you are there over lunchtime so I would guess a light lunch would be ok .. tho I know lots of others will know a lot more than me about it and give you much better advice xx
Posts.Title: Marker clip and chemo?

Posts.Content: Now you know you were just playing at it fellow Ali! Most people just need to engage brain before opening mouth eh?! Xxx
Posts.Title: stupid comments part 1!!!!!

Posts.Content: Fantastic news, well done, so pleased for you. Love reading posts like this xx
Posts.Title: survivor

Posts.Content: Hi Mags, she should be fine with having her marker in then ... I started my chemo at the end of October and they put my marker in on 19th December. It's such a small incision that they make to put it in that there should be no problems with healing. Mine was easier than the biopsies I had! I wish her luck with her journey ... she is lucky to have you to support her, as I have been with both of my daughters xxx
Posts.Title: Marker clip and chemo?

Posts.Content: My chemo nurse told me to avoid perfumed products for a week at least, and recommended Simple. I've been reading other threads about deodorant  ... nobody ever told me anything about changing during chemo so I carried on using the same. But I don't think I should when it comes to rads? Can anyone help me with this? Thanks xx
Posts.Title: well thats not gone to plan !!!!!!

Posts.Content: Oh no Ali, that's not good. I had similar problem with mine, in fact still feels bit strange at times and it's been out for 11 days now. I put it down to the skin being sensitive as it's been permanently covered by a dressing for 5 months. It's certainly a different colour under where the dressing was. It's getting a little better each day tho, so hopefully yours will too. Did they tell you not to use perfumed shower gel/body wash? Xx
Posts.Title: well thats not gone to plan !!!!!!

Posts.Content: Thanks Judith, that's great. Having my op on 10th April so don't have dates for rads yet but trying to get as much info as I can beforehand. Will start another thread about my op cos I'm having therapeutic mammoplasty and I haven't read any posts about that ... I'm hoping there will be some who have had the same who are willing to share their experiences xx
Posts.Title: well thats not gone to plan !!!!!!

Posts.Content: Mmmmm lovely Italian dishes! Was gonna say something about balls .... but it's Sunday! Lol. I've just finished blitzing the house cos I've got my surgery Tuesday,  so am gonna treat myself to a cheeky late lunchtime baileys and do nothing for a while xx
Posts.Title: seize the day

Posts.Content: Yes fellow Ali, it does seem to be normal. Mine have been feeling like that for a while now ... and my fingertips look like they belong to a 90 year old!! I had my last chemo 3 and a half weeks ago and have been trying to finish a huge cross stitch pic ever since but my fingertips just don't want to play ball! :-(  does anyone know how long it usually lasts? Xx
Posts.Title: weird question? ??

Posts.Content: Oh and I changed my nail varnish tonight ... I also have two black toenails (the big ones) and when I took it off my hands, both of my thumbnails look lightly bruised! Really hope I can keep my fingernails, they've always been really strong and quite long ... but what will be will be I guess xx
Posts.Title: weird question? ??

Posts.Content: Just back from hospital where I had my first 'solo' herceptin (finished chemo 3 weeks ago) .... and when it was finished they took my picc line out! Last week they started doing sub-cut injections for herceptin, so the nurse phoned my consultant and she is very happy for me to switch to sub-cut. My picc line has been very good to me, but it feels so good that I have my Wednesdays back with no more waiting in for the nurse. Another milestone ticked off  ... onwards and upwards towards op on 10th April then rads. .. then the summer to myself! xx
Posts.Title: Freedom!

Posts.Content: I know that feeling only too well unfortunately  ... if it hadn't been my last one I really think I would have said NO MORE! I sailed through my fec and though everyone told me how awful tax might be, I really wasn't prepared for it! Didn't help going to work after the second one for a few days ... and my supervisor not warning me she'd had a streaming cold all weekend  ... and I ended up in hospital with flu and dehydrated. But that already seems like a distant memory! Can't believe I've done it xx
Posts.Title: Freedom!

Posts.Content: I know ali owl I was following your thread with your picc problems ... I felt a bit guilty cos I've never had any problems with mine. When have they said yours can come out? I hope your last chemo is kinder to you than mine was to me ... mine was a real bi***! I had two and a half weeks of 'please stop the world' days ... but it was a little easier knowing it should be the last time I felt like that. Good luck to you for the next couple of weeks xx
Posts.Title: Freedom!

Posts.Content: I know what you mean ... The soles of my feet feel like they're on fire when I walk! Had to walk to the shops today and I was scared they would pull me into the old people's home when I shuffled past! Lol xxx
Posts.Title: sill question !!!!!!

Posts.Content: It was a giant chocolate covered donut with a gerbil popping his head up through the hole! He asked for gerbils for his birthday  and when I took it over last night she told him that was the only gerbil he was getting! He is getting two really  ... His birthday is today. Xxx
Posts.Title: sill question !!!!!!

Posts.Content: Well to be honest I thought the gerbil looked like something out of Alien  lol ... but everyone else loved it! Xx
Posts.Title: sill question !!!!!!

Posts.Content: Well I'm a size 6 too so it's simple! If we both lose a foot then we just make sure it's not the same one! Then I have the one you don't lose and you have a matching pair off Maggie!  I have a feeling she might prefer the chocolates option tho lol xx
Posts.Title: sill question !!!!!!

Posts.Content: Or I could just make you a foot - shaped cake?! Lol xxx
Posts.Title: sill question !!!!!!

Posts.Content: Not a silly question fellow Ali ... I've been wondering the same! I avoided it while I was on chemo ... but my addled chemo - brain can't remember for the life of me why!! Hope someone posts the answer quick ... have spent the last 2 days on my feet making birthday cakes and a foot spa sounds like heaven!! How was your injection today? Xxx
Posts.Title: sill question !!!!!!

Posts.Content: No Ali, not my birthday but I love making cakes ... made one for my friend's son yesterday and started work on her daughter's 21st one today xx I just tried to upload a pic of the one I made yesterday but it was too big apparently :-(  xx
Posts.Title: sill question !!!!!!

Posts.Content: Don't blame you at all ... All of us ladies deserve to be treated like Queens and have two birthdays! Just bought my lottery ticket for tonight  ... any winnings go straight in the jar ... have been saving my lottery wins since end of January and so far it contains  £96 ... A very long way to go but I will get there! Xxx
Posts.Title: Lumpectomy on my birthday...what a present!

Posts.Content: Don't blame you at all ... All of us ladies deserve to be treated like Queens and have two birthdays! Posts.Title: Lumpectomy on my birthday...what a present!

Posts.Content: Hi Wendy, if it was me I would see it as the best birthday present you could hope for ... eviction of your intruder! Why can't you hang glide for your 60th? I went to Paris with my sister and a couple of her friends for her 60th. She asked me what we're gonna do for mine and I joked about going to Vegas. That was a year before diagnosis and it's no longer a joke! My girls bought me a beautiful savings jar for mothers day and I have written on it "we're going to Vegas November 2018". AND I'm planning on doing a skydive while I'm there too. So you go do whatever you want ... you deserve it! Xxx
Posts.Title: Lumpectomy on my birthday...what a present!

Posts.Content: I had prepared myself for the possibility of needing another op to clear margins, but not for this! I actually felt sorry for the surgeon having to tell me ... He was so positive before the op and thought at most I would need a smaller op to clear margins followed by radiotherapy. He was so apologetic and really lovely with me. My BCN was also amazing, and now that I've told all the family and quite a few of my friends I am beginning to feel stronger again xx
Posts.Title: Disappointment

Posts.Content: I had prepared myself for the possibility of needing another op to clear margins, but not for this! I actually felt sorry for the surgeon having to tell me ... He was so positive before the op and thought at most I would need a smaller op to clear margins followed by radiotherapy. He was so apologetic and really lovely with me. My BCN was also amazing, and now that I've told all the family and quite a few of my friends I am beginning to feel stronger again xx
Posts.Title: Disappointment

Posts.Content: Hi all, well I hoped to be posting a much happier post than this! I had my operation follow - up with the surgeon this morning.  After 6 chemo it really looked like my lump had shrunk considerably and the surgeon really thought that the TM and radiotherapy would be an end to it. Unfortunately not to be. They discovered during the op that it is far more extensive than the scans showed but luckily all still contained in the same breast. It seems that chemo may have shattered it, which is apparently not uncommon - in fact I was warned about it before but like everything "it wasn't gonna happen to me!". So the only option now is mastectomy. My surgeon was as disappointed as me, he has done such a fantastic job and my 'new boob' is healing so well and looks amazing! I cried in his office ... The first time I have cried in front of anyone outside of the house since diagnosis! Made me feel better tho, and now I have told the family I can feel my strength returning. And if anyone asks why I didn't have mastectomy in the first place then they better be prepared for a smack in the mouth!! (Even if only a verbal one) xx
Posts.Title: Disappointment

Posts.Title: Disappointment

Posts.Content: Thanks everyone for your kind words and wishes. I'm feeling a little better today, tho still a bit low. Like I said I was mentally prepared for him to say that I needed another op to get clear margins but definitely wasn't expecting to have to lose the whole boob! I think I would have been better had he said come back Friday and we'll do it ... The 5 week wait is just too much thinking time. He said that in my case it would be delayed reconstruction  ... but everything by that point had become white noise, so I really don't remember why. Have to go to hospital for herceptin on Friday so I'm gonna try to see my BCN while I'm there. Going out for a meal with my best friend tonight .... and not being allowed to drive, it's my turn to drink ... don't mind if I do thanks ;-) xx
Posts.Title: Disappointment

Posts.Content: How was the injection? Got my next one Friday and gonna take the advice from here and ask if I can hold it to warm it first,  then ask for it a bit higher in my thigh too. Massive hugs and good wishes for tomorrow xxx
